Reviews.Title: “our last 4 days in turkey”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette B
Reviews.Content: we had a very good stay at the hotel saba , the location was very good , the staff very nice & helpful , breakfasts were good & the rooms were clean & comfortable . overall a very good experience,thanks to you all from the the 3 aussies jenny judi & mariell

Reviews.Title: “quiet location and spacious standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: eboStockholm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just near Blue moskee, and close to both bazaar and histrical monuments. Unfortunately we got a room without real window, just one opening to a warm ventilation shakt which gave us some hard nights as the earlier guest was a smooker. Hard were also the beds. After a few days the air in the room got a little better, fortunately the air con worked well. The room has a refrigerator which we appreciated. The staff was fiendly (as most people in Istanbul) and the hotel had a familiar touch. Breakfast OK compared to turkish standard. DonÂ´t forget to bring schampoo as the hotel only provide soap. We should of course have changed room, then the review would have been more positive. I can recommend the hotel because of friendly athmosphere and prefect location. Hotels closer to the sea would give you a long uphill walk every day. Thus perfect for old people who donÂ´t like climbing hills

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: vincenzo101
Reviews.Content: Been traveling for several months, and have stayed in 5star deluxe to second rate dumps. This was the best hotel of all. An incrediable value, in a great location. You are footsteps away from all the sights, shopping and restaurants. The rooms were comfortable, very very clean, and the staff all wonderfully warm and helpful. I can' say enough good things. GO!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Tessa G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saba is brilliantly located near the most famous sights of Istanbul. The staff were helpful, the rooms more than adequate for the price, and the breakfasts generous in a wonderful roof-top terrace with a view of the Blue Mosque. Always warm despite bitter outside temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Kimmo J
Reviews.Content: Very good price-quality ratio! I stayed in Saba Hotel for one week in chilly November. The location is perfect for sightseeing, trams, shopping. Still Saba is neatly off the route of Sultanahmet crowds. You will find nearby supermarket, laundry, internet cafe, restaurants, normal life plus the fabulous sights. The rooms are very basic, but clean, with hot water, heating and aircon. Roof-top breakfast hall with breath-taking views to Marmara and Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia compensate the small room. Hassle-free shuttle service from the Ataturk Airport. I enjoyed very friendly service here in the reception and in the cafeteria. Ask for the roof top suite! Staff was helpful and active and contributed to my incipient Turkish skills always with a smile. Selamlar FinlandiyaÂ´dan!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saba Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryBassett
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Tajikistan, having routed twice through Istanbul. both times we stayed at the Hotel Saba. It was my husband's fourth time there. the location is excellent and close to anything you want to visit. Muyesser was very helpful and we felt that we were very lucky to find such a great place. Clean., comfortable , the beds were wonderful, especially after Tajikistan! Everything was really clean and the breakfast was great, especially overlooking the Blue Mosque. We will certainly stay there again when we return to Istanbul next Spring. Muyesser, thank you for your kindness, and for putting us in such delightful rooms. Good luck to you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mesut A
Reviews.Content: We have arrived Hotel Saba at the afternoon, we got what we have booked. The scene of the terrace is just perfect. The hotel staff is friendly and polite. We have enjoyed our stay and happy that we have found ourselves a nice place at the centre of old city.It is simple and nice. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Good location (nice terrace view), good breakfast....no frills room with horrible service,”
Reviews.Author: VPraj
Reviews.Content: Ok, so, there are pro's and con's to this place. Con's -Service is horrendous. I am really not that picky, or at least I don't think I am when it comes to service, but we booked 2 double rooms, 4 beds in total more than 6 months before arrival. When we got there we were told our rooms were given up and we'd have to take one double room and one single room. They weren't sorry, they didn't offer a refund (of the difference in price) and weren't nice at all about it. The single room was a twin bed, had only one towel, one blanket, one everything (since it's meant for 1), they didn't restock anything for two, only for one, so we had to ask every night for extra everything. They don't speak English well and takes a long time for them to understand simple things, "two towels" , "would like two beds", "one more blanket". If it weren't for the staff, I'd rate this place at least average. I'd reccomend calling them in advance to make sure everything is settled, their excuse for the over booking was that the computer booked it for them and they have misrepresented what is available electronically. (Beware!) -Room is small, single room is tiny... there hardly room to unpack your carry on luggage. -Morning (5:00am) prayer is very loud since you are very close to the Mosque (I suppose that's everywhere too) Pro's -Great view from terrace, can see the Ayasofya and Blue Mosque nicely and also the water (the thing is everywhere in Istanbul in this area there is the same view). At night its nice to go up there and have a drink before bed. -Location is very close to Sultanahmet tram stop on the T1 line -Breakfast is pretty good lots of choice, lots of cheeses, feta, mozzerella (really salty), eggs, sausauge, hams, cucumber, phyllo dough filled cheese pastries, tomato, cereal, toast, coffee and tea are kinda lacking

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for value with helpfull staff and great teras”
Reviews.Author: Sertan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in May booking for a good value in May 2011. Although at first I get very disappointed with the location of my room, which had only one window looking at the ventilation space with lots of airco working, I loved the teras view and with the help of staff, I enjoyed the teras most of the time in my stay. The personnel were really friendly and helpful, even once I saw them carry a very drunk woman came hotel to her room on shoulder when I was there. They do not have dinner but arranged me dinner and drinks to enjoy at their teras, from a delicious budget kebap restaurant nearby, and the teras view was better than any expensive restaurant in that very touristic location. This Hotel is definitely good for its value. Only problem was the location of the room, no view from your window and the ventilation space was not well designed, so airco does not work well. Then the teras comes for help and we only use our room for sleeping. Watch for the seagulls that steal your food in breakfast! To conclude, hotel is nice, personnel is nice, teras is excellent, rooms are not, seagulls are not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to spend time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Leo F
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent and the staff was the best. Especially Muyesser. She has a wonderful attitude and always willing to help anyone with any questions they may have on shopping or taking tours. O pleasure to stay in this hotel and get the treatment that I did. I definietly plan on staying there on my return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: AnetteFevre
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saba and the friendly staff gave my friend and me a warm welcoming when we arrived at the hotel. We felt at ease instantly. The staff also helped us choosing the sights that gave the best experience and the best value for money - and they helped us book and gave insigtful tips to which places to go on which days. The terresse on the roof of the hotel was amazing - the view over the Bosphoros and the Blue Moske and Hagia Sophia was better than anywhere else. - sitting in the sun and eating the great turkish breakfast and enjoying the view was an incredibly luxuious beginning of the day. The rooms were good and clean - also the bathrooms - and the beds were perfectly soft. There was no disturbing noises at night - and the location couldn't have been better!! I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends and familiy - in fact I already have :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Selim09
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, near touristic attractions and restaurants. Wonderful view from breakfast room: Aya sophia, Blue Mosque, Marmara Sea. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Greet72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a clean, albeit very small, single room. The biggest selling point for this hotel is the absolute premium location (50 metres from Hyppodrome, 100 metres from the Blue Mosque and about 300 metres from the Aya Sophia). Despite this location the hotel was very quiet. The staff is friendly & eager to help. If you'd ask me for a downside I'd say that the bed was rather hard. But overall; simple but good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Cozy, Stones throw away to Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Shahzaad
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Great views of the area from the top floor where breakfast is served. Assistance from the reception in the late evening was very warm and welcoming(thank you once again Brother . Good decent facilities for a comfy shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JannatSaleem
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a perfect location. The staff were friendly and able to assist with everything that was asked of them,. My 6 year old son had a great time and they were very kind and patient with him. The triple room isn't big but it was clean and served it's purpose well. The view from the roof terrace is fabulous. Perfect, central location-2 minutes to major sites and 10 mins to Grand bazaar.This was my second stay here and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “it was the 4th time I stayed in Saba hotel and I will come again!”
Reviews.Author: ekua1707
Reviews.Content: I like hotel Saba - nice hotel with friendly people - clean rooms - excellent breakfast with a beautiful view - walking distance from most interesting places - advice for trips

Reviews.Title: “i felt like family at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghanasheli
Reviews.Content: The Saba is a well run hotel with reasonable rates. I loved all the staff and had a wonderful stay. In particular Muyesser Seker at the desk was a jewel. She helped me organize trips, sightseeing and was above all a lovely and generous host. The rooms were clean and comfortable (bed could have been softer though.. a bit hard) and the view from the breakfast terrace is unbeatable. I would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position but beware of scams”
Reviews.Author: bellamanning
Reviews.Content: After reading the excellent reviews on tripadvisor, we were greatly looking forward to our stay, however, things did not go smoothly. Despite having booked the room three months before our stay and specifically requesting a quiet room with a double bed and sea view and following the advice of a reviewer on here, I emailing our flight times for pick up â€“ I also faxed these details to the hotel a week before and received an email reply. There was no-one at the airport to meet our fight and provide the complimentary transfer, which was included with our booking as it was for 7 nights, with www.Venere.com. I telephoned the hotel and they asked us to wait while they found out what was happening. Eventually after about 30 minutes we were guided to a shared taxi, which dropped us near (not at) the hotel. We were given a room with twin beds, one on each side of the room, so they could not even be pushed together and the window opened out onto what is effectively a chimney with all the aircon units from the other rooms in it. It was dark and noisy and we were next to the lift. The TV was tiny and high up on the wall so only visible from one bed and it didn't even work properly. The room was very small and the light fitting was falling off the wall. I complained at reception and was told the hotel was completely full and that we could move rooms in the morning. I really wanted to go home there and then, but as there seemed no alternative, we agreed to that. In the meantime the receptionist was trying to sell us a tourist boat trip for the next day which cost 65 Euros each and she was being very persistent. We said we wanted to get the room situation sorted out first, so we would have to do it another day. Every day she pestered us about the boat trip, but if you go to Eminonu, where all the boats and ferries go from (walk or 2 stops on the tram) you can get a one and a half hour boat trip up the Bosphorus for 10 TL each â€“ that's just over 5 Euros each â€“ a bit of a difference and a very enjoyable trip. The next morning they did offer us a much better room, overlooking the street, which was fine, but it had no balcony or view. It was very clean, with fresh towels provided every day. The hotel certainly wasn't full that day, as there were lots of empty rooms on our floor. There can be no denying that the position of the hotel is brilliant and the view from the breakfast terrace was also superb. The breakfast was fine for me, as it had bread, salad and cheese, but my husband, the carnivore, wasn't keen on any of the so-called meats and nothing was hot. They also had cold chips (French Fries) and cold hard boiled eggs. That was OK until one day the eggs had not been cooked properly and they were cold runny eggs, which were revolting and inedible. The hotel web page states that there is wireless internet in every room and free internet access via PC in the lobby. This is not true. There is only wireless internet in the lobby and no public computer. The hotel web page also says there are mini-bars in every room which is also not true, there are just small empty fridges (still very welcome though). We ate at the local restaurants and found one in the Hippodrome (3rd on left) which served wine at a reasonable cost (most do not serve wine and if they do it is incredibly expensive) and had reasonable food. Most of the restaurants seem to pester you to go in. Once the hotel realised that we were not going to take the boat trip excursion, they then started to try and sell us an airport transfer for 25 Euros. We found one in town for 20 TL, which was very efficient (bear in mind it takes an hour to get to the airport because the traffic is permanently gridlocked.) The final and incredible act of trying to get money out of us, came as we were about to leave and the receptionist said wait a minute, you have a bill. We were very surprised as we had not purchased anything there. She said we owed them 5TL for the map I had requested when we first arrived! This is the first time I have EVER been charged for a map in a hotel. They are always free, all over the world, no matter how few stars the hotel has. We were so taken aback, we paid her, but afterwards wished we had not, there was no mention ever of a charge for the map! All in all, this left a very bad taste in the mouth. I could not recommend this hotel, especially if you are on business. There are lots of other small hotels in that area worth investigating and we heard other guests voice complaints as well, while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “shady shady shady”
Reviews.Author: fraqua3
Reviews.Content: long story short, there is something shady going on with this hotel. we booked our room through travelocity.com but when we got there the staff was extremely rude and unapologetic when they told us they didnt have any room for us, even though my credit card had already been charged. they proceeded to tell us that we were very lucky, beacuse they found another room in another hotel down the block. they had us lug our suitcases up and down cobblestone roads to the other hotel, which happened to be a DUMP. but alas we had no choice, as we'd already been charged the $160 for a double bed at hotel saba. clearly the second hotel would not rake in that much for their dirty, tiny rooms. the shadiest part was that the manager from hotel saba seemed to be verrry buddy buddy with the manager from the second hotel - very very shady. these people are clearly taking advantage of tourists that have no other resources to know better. these are not people to be trusted, i would absolutely not recommend that anyone stay at hotel saba.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Matresss spoilt Stay - go elswhere!”
Reviews.Author: jimfol
Reviews.Content: Great location for all the sites. Booked double room and ended up with a twin room even though we booked well in advance. We were shown a spare double but you could hear the lift every time it passed the room and it had noisy aircon and bathroom fittings falling off wall. Offered a superior suite for more money but decided against - please note all the beds in these rooms were HARD or should I say ORTHOPEDIC! LAUGH!(I'm surprised no-one else mentions the beds?) Staff were ok and helpfull. Breakfast was terrible - If you don't like cheese and yoghurt, and something that is supposed to be meat, don't stay here. Good job there were boiled eggs and bread! My wife thought it was ok cause she likes all that stuff. All in all Istanbul is great, but we were knackered by the time we got back home due to the lack of sleep. I think in hindsight we should have spent more money on a more up market hotel - you live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Davidstotlar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Istanbul and booked a room online with Hotel Saba. The location cannot be beat. 1/2 block from the hyppodrome, 2 blocks from the Blue Mosque and 3 from Aya Sofya. Also 3 blocks from the street tram. Taking the tram, it's 2 stop one way for the Spice Bazaar and 2 stops the other for the Grand Bazaar. Our room (403) had a wonderful balcony (8ft. x 12 feet) that over looked the sea and Bosphorus (404 has a similar balcony, but 403 is better) . Magificent views of the ships and also the Blue Mosque, especially at night. You should sleep on the balcony. The beds were stone hard and the rooms comparable to Motel 6. But the location makes up for it. Service is OK, the desk arranged for airport transfer which was on schedule and efficient. They forgot to mention that you had to pay for it in cash TK lira, all of which I had spent in prep for leaving in the morning. So a scramble for the ATM was needed. Hotel includes breakfast on their roof-top patio which is also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel near major attractions with questionable customer service.”
Reviews.Author: sallys04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Saba Hotel for four nights in May. This was a very nice budget hotel on a quiet street very close to the major attractions of the Sultanahmet area and to public transportation. The room was very clean, bathroom with shower was very nice. Wifi internet access was available in the lobby. The breakfasts were very good, plenty of options available even for those who might not like the typical Turkish breakfast (which we loved). The view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast terrace was nothing short of stunning. We booked the hotel for four nights directly on the hotel's own website. Because we booked for four nights, we got a discount on the room rate as well as a free pickup from the airport. Although we requested this pickup and filled in our flight information, no one was at the airport to pick us up. After waiting around for about an hour, another driver from another hotel called the Saba Hotel and arranged to take us there. We spoke to the woman at the front desk via his cell phone, and she assured us that they realized it is their responsibility. The driver told us there would be no charge. But when we checked out, the hotel wanted to charge us for the pickup. They claimed that, in spite of having filled in the flight information on the reservation page, we were supposed to have sent them an email with the information. After arguing for one hour, they finally agreed not to charge us. Recommendation: be sure to send them the flight information by email and receive a written confirmation from them that they will be picking you up. Your hotel reservation confirmation saying "free airport pickup" apparently is not sufficient. Our only other complaint was that the staff always seemed to want to sell tourist package deals rather than just helping answer questions. We did have a wonderful stay with those two caveats, and we would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: goonerWatfordEngland
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just arrived back from the saba hoter we went for her 60th birthday and we really could not have stayed at a better hotel the staff are lovely very helpful and always on hand to sort anything out for you the room we had 204 was very clean the maids work very hard the breakfast was very good as you would expect typical turkish very nice and as much as you can eat the view from the breakfast terrace will blow you away the hotel is in a very quite side street very very near to all the main sites all i can say is a very big thank you to the hotel saba and all the staff for making our trip to istanbul one we will always remember

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view but uncomfortable room much money”
Reviews.Author: kinderdoc
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with own balcony for 140 Euro one night. What we get was an uncomfortable room , which has no own balcony, just using the balcony from the breakfastroom. Our romm has a beautful view, but 140 Euro isnt worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything, yet quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Aluwi
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to all the historical sites in and around Sultanameth. Very friendly and helpful staff. The view from the breakfast roof terrace is breathtaking, whatever the weather â€“ Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmar, and a very nice breakfast buffet. Rooms are small but quite enough and bathrooms are very fresh. Next time in istanbul I will try stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: vandevyver
Reviews.Content: I was at the Saba hotel with my parent for 6 days.Rooms were very good,clean! It's nearby the Hippodroom?Blue Mosque,Aya Sophia,.... it was a SUPER location! Breakfast was on topfloor and it was possible to sit outside on the terrace wit BLUE MOSQUE view! Beautifull! A real good breakfastbuffet everything was there,bread,cheese,jam,tomatos,cucumber,butter,... so really good. People at reception are very kind and they help you really! I am travelagent and I can compare different hotels, it was the 4 time Istanbul but 1st time SABA hotel and I've booked again for october 2010 so good was it! For me 1 adress good service, clean and central location book SABA! You can have also taxitransfer from airport to hotel and return and you can bbook it in advance directly by the hotel for interesting price! So everybody enjoy Istanbul and enjoy your stay at SABA HOTEL !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: kdh1716
Reviews.Content: The Saba is a little hotel just around the corner from the Blue Mosque and the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts. The location is superb. You are in easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi. The Grand Bazar can be reached by a longer walk or a quick ride on the Tram. The easy access to the Tram makes the whole city accessable. The rooms are a little small and spartan but two of the rooms have terraces with views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Maramara. We stayed in one of them, Room 404, and thought it was worth the extra money. We found the staff to be helpful, competent and friendly. We tend to like to explore on our own but the staff made a few reservations for us and made good recommendations. They were quite happy to set up tours and such and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people”
Reviews.Author: LondonSaba
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, reasonable price, and great location with nice people. What else can I say? I enjoyed staying there very much. Especially it was great to see Blue Mosque when I had my breakfast! Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - I will stay here whenever I travel to Istanbul in the future.”
Reviews.Author: travel_KCC
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Saba hotel for the week that overlapped the end of November and start of December; so definitely in off-season. I found the hotel lovely and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The location is smack bang in the middle of the historic centre of Sutanahmet, whilst being just enough off the Hippodrome area so as to not be negatively affected by the crowds. I used the hotel mainly as a base for seeing Istanbul and so was out most of the day and evening. The view from my room was not too interesting, but then I don't spend my time in hotel rooms looking at the view. However, the view from the upstairs terrace is spectacular and the photos available do not do it justice. I had no worries or problems with the hotel in any way and enjoyed my time there. Having spent a week walking all over Istanbul it is obvious that there are a _lot_ of hotels around and the standards vary wildly. I am very glad I ended up here - mainly after reading through the many positive on-line reviews. I am more than happy to add my own. I will be returning to Istanbul next year and I have to admit that the experience at the Saba Hotel has influenced that decision. I will certainly be returning to this hotel. Kenneth

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saba offered the best service, comfort, and price of all the hotels I found in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: JLB1910
Reviews.Content: From the moment of our arrival in Istanbul, the staff of Hotel Saba, led by Muyesser Seker, made my friends and me -- first-time travelers to Turkey -- feel welcome and at home. They took care of all of our lodging needs, fed us scrumptious breakfasts each morning on their stunning roof-top cafe, gave us touring advice, and even helped us practice our Turkish language skills! The computer with internet service in the lobby was always operational for our needs and a friendly face was behind the front desk ready to serve us at any hour of the day. Along with the superiority of the staff was the hotel's proximity to the tram line and its spectacular view of the Bosporus, the Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia. Because I had to stay a week longer in Istanbul for work after my friends returned to America, I changed hotels at the recommendation of my employment sponsor. What a mistake! The second hotel could not compare to the cleanliness, the breakfast proportions and quality, the professionalism, or the friendliness of the staff at Hotel Saba. I began spending the afternoons at Hotel Saba just to retreat to what felt like a safe and welcoming place even though I was sleeping at another hotel! When I return to Istanbul, Hotel Saba is the only place I will ever stay.

Reviews.Title: “If Saba Hotel is available stay there,No need to have a risk.”
Reviews.Author: jjoe_black
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Istanbul Saba is the only hotel that I prefer because of its location ,peacefull atmosphere and its comfort. I always miss to have the breakfast on the roof with an amazing view. wanna say again It is the only place to have a stay if you need a room in Sultanahmet,Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Svetlaniye
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for visiting such sights as Aya Sofia, Sultanahmet Mosque, Top Kapi and Basilica Cistern. Also very convenient train line near the hotel. I liked there everything from hotel staff which was very friendly till the screaming of seagulls :))) during the breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “''Its location and the view from the room 403 & terrace are enough ''”
Reviews.Author: pablo6800
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the internet and were impressed by their prompt and friendly response. We finished a cruise and did need a hotel in Instanbul for three days. It is ideally located within a very short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia,Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Turkish Islamic and Art Museum. The staff are helpful and friendly and the room was comfortable and well equipped. They booked us an all day tour on the Bosphorus and the Asian quarter.If you are in Ä°stanbul the first day you should have the Bosphorous trip. This was well worth taking. The hotel has wifi internet access and also provides transport to the airport which saved us the hassle of dealing with turkish taxi drivers which was not a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location & cozy Staff”
Reviews.Author: ILAYDAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in october 2009, and it was simply a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful ! You can't get a better location -- opposite the Blue Mosque in the Hippodrome - can go to the, Hagya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, etc. by walking. The breakfast was served on the rooftop, with great views!I advise you to get the hotel's airport services.We got a taxi to g oto the hotel,Taxi driver could not find the hotel did get all around the town, and had paid too much and lost time after a long flight. We took the hotelâ€™s service to g oto the airport witout stres and we safe time and MONEY.I absolutely advise her efor your vacations The front desk department is good at their business.We want to thank you for their advises.We had fun time with the booking tours ,restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “very "sympa"”
Reviews.Author: istanboelisten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with 10 women !! While we had no program we had to find out everythig like visits, restaurtants... The staff of the hotel was very, very, kind to us and give plenty of information and made reservations. The location of the hotel is splendid, the rooms are clean but not every room has good view. Sorry for being a noisy group ! Our special regards to the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: yenikoy
Reviews.Content: We came to Saba Hotel totally unprepared for this pleasent surprise. We are Istanbulites living in Paris, Miami and Bodrum. As we sold our apartment in Istanbul last year, we were kind of anxious about our first time as tourists in Istanbul. I knew this great guy Davud from Turista Travel agency . He was our saviour. He booked this hotel in the most touristic part of the city. We were going to play tourists in the city that we lived for years as locals. It was scary and exciting..The service was friendly, the rooms very clean. The breakfast terrace was out of a movie "Topkapi"...The view was unbelievable, Sultan Ahmet Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Marmara sea...Totally breath taking...I named one of the cheeky sea gulls who insisted on having breakfast with us in the terrace "Sultan Ahmet".. He eats from your hands...Loves a sausage and cheeze...The staff was friendly and polite. You are in the center of old Istanbul. The Bazaar, the museums...Everything is around you. WE came as customers and left as friends...Great Experience and we recommend this hotel . Dilek and Eric Clarke

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were hoping to get.”
Reviews.Author: Equord
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for serious sightseeing trip to Istanbul, with good value for money. Very convenient location right next to main cultural attractions in the old city. Very friendly and knowledgeable personnel. Very good service. Clean, nicely furnished rooms. Roof top terrace with great view, on which breakfast is served. Free wireless LAN in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel , fantastic location , awesome staff .”
Reviews.Author: winky111276
Reviews.Content: would stay here again , the staff are ever sooo friendly and are so willing to help , perefct location for seeing the sights of istanbul , near to most things of interest .

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rita022
Reviews.Content: -When in Istanbul-I am staying in Saba Hotel for 14 years I very much recommend hotel Saba for anyone. The hotel is beautifully located in the old part of Istanbul called Sultanahmet. The accommodation includes continental breakfasts on a terrace with a view on Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Bosphorus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation for staying in hotel SABA while in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kaulikova
Reviews.Content: I very much recommend hotel Saba for anyone who wants to spend some time in Istanbul. The hotel is beautifully located in the old part of Istanbul called Sultanahmet. The accommodation includes continental breakfasts on a terrace with a view on Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Bosphorus. They even pick you up from the airport upon the arrival to Istanbul and this is free of charge! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Beware beware!”
Reviews.Author: EvanBristol
Reviews.Content: A most unpleasant scam. We had booked & paid for seven nights in rooms with city views. On arrival (at 0015 after 12 hours' travelling) we were told there were no rooms available and we had to move to what was a dingy hotel in Aksaray 'for two nights'. We were given false assurances about rooms which would then become available. Deliberate overbooking, therefore, and being shovelled into unpleasant little rooms miles away. One would think it was more than the hotel's reputation was worth to do this. We noticed other guests complaining about their accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Michel013
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel following a bad experience elsewhere. At 80 euros a night it seemed quite good value.Rooms are fairly basic but clean. Fantastic view from rooftop terrace but quality of breakfast indifferent ie fake orange juice and tasteless coffee but staff are extremely helpful,booked restaurants etc Location is also good for main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Complete rip off - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tess_Jane_London
Reviews.Content: This hotel changes its prices and tries to rip you off. First they quoted us a price in lira and the next day when we came to pay they said the exchange rate with the Euro had changed so we had to pay more. A lot more. Secondly, i asked the price of a room for an extra night over and above what we had booked. They quoted me a price but when we came to check out they said that this was the price for an extra bed (we didn't even have an extra bed!) and that we had to pay 65 Euros more than we had agreed the previous day. When we refused they threatened to call the police and had copies of our passports so we couldn't just leave. We had a ferry to catch so we ended up paying the full amount just to get away (the girl refused to contact the manager). I think they bank on the fact that you're too scared to let them call the police but they know full well its a scam. The rooms are also tiny and very noisy. There is far better and cheaper accommodation in Istanbul, in fact everywhere else we stayed was both better and cheaper! DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gav_Kate
Reviews.Content: I and 3 friends stayed at the Hotel Saba for a short break. We paid Â£80 per person for 3 nights, which we felt was excellent value for money. The hotel was basic, but clean and tidy. With the only major downfall being the paper thin walls, as the even the slightest noise could be heard from all areas of the hotel. The hotel was located right in the middle of the old town, a couple of minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, which is good for sightseeing and excellent breakfast views, but not ideal in the early hours of the morning during prayer call. Iâ€™d personally recommend staying in the New Town, as I would have prefered to have been located closer to the restaurants and bars on the evening and travel to the tourist attractions during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but thatâ€™s it”
Reviews.Author: zoonabar
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the quality of the hotel and the general service provided by its staff. According to the website and even the brochures available in the hotelâ€™s reception area, all rooms were supposed to have wireless internet, in room safe and a mini-bar, however my room had none if these facilities. When I questioned the staff about this I was given an indifferent shrug of the shoulders and was told that that information was out of date. I was then asked as why I required them as if I was unreasonable. The rooms themselves were clean and modern; however my room was rather small. The breakfast provided as rather poor in quality and I heard a member of staff questioning another hotel guest when they went back for a second helping of something. The location of this hotel however was excellent, situated at the end of the Hippodrome so itâ€™s an easy walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “not completely honest”
Reviews.Author: 2much2C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the good reviews on trip advisor and checking out their site. I was disappointed to discover that despite clearly stating on the site that there is a fitness room, there is actually no such thing. Instead there is a room in the basement with a small stepper and a bike that doesn't work. When I brought this up with the staff (as part of our reason for booking here was the fitness room) they were completely unapologetic and told me I could go walking in the area instead! I'm not sure if there has been a change of staff since the previous reviews of friendly and helpful people on the reception, but that was not our experience. Our room was also very small, the bathroom was a squeeze with a tiny sink and we were told if we wanted a bigger room we would have to pay more. Apart from that I must say that the breakfast was good and was served on a fantastic terrace with great views - this was a redeeming factor and so we decided moving hotels was not worth the hassle. Also - there is no need to book an expensive taxi through the hotel as airport transfer can be arranged in a minibus for 3-4 euros or if you don't have much luggage you can use the tram and then metro from sultanahmet, which takes around 45 mins.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Sultanahmet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavrik
Reviews.Content: Touristâ€™s critique of Hotel Saba, Istanbul My recent stay at the Hotel Saba in Istanbul was my fourth, which already indicates that I have been very pleased with past visits. The Sabaâ€™s rates are very reasonable and represent an excellent bargain in comparison with the competition. The location of the Saba is really perfect for anyone wishing to visit the tourist attractions of the Sultanahmet region of the city. Although situated on a quiet side street, the Saba is literally a stoneâ€™s throw from the Hippodrome, which means that the Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque are within a few minutes walk from the hotel â€“ so close, in fact, that getting to these places by any means other than walking would be silly. It is also worthy of note that the Saba is on the same elevation as the main tourist attractions of Sultanahmet. This is not true of many hotels in the same area that advertise their proximity to surrounding attractions but neglect to mention that you must climb very steep hills to get from their hotels to the main tourist area. Not so from the Saba. Also within a very short distance from the hotel â€“ at the other end of the Hippodrome â€“ is the trolley line that provides convenient and inexpensive transportation to the Spice Market, the Grand Bazaar, the University, and easy connections to the main shopping boulevard of the city, Istiklal. The rooms that I have occupied at the Saba have been very satisfactory. They are spotlessly clean, well lit and handsomely furnished. Towels and bedding are changed daily. An elevator takes guests to the various floors and to the beautiful balcony, where the hotelâ€™s excellent free breakfast buffet is served every morning. The view of the ships at sea, as well as of the nearby Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya, is breathtaking. There is even a â€œregularâ€� seagull visitor on the balconyâ€™s marble railing every morning, on the lookout for free snacks and keeping other gulls away. The personnel of the Saba are extremely affable and helpful and speak very good English, as well as an assortment of other European languages. They are always willing to provide services and information about the city and assist guests to the extent that they can, regardless of the nature of the problem. The only negative note I must add to my evaluation of the Hotel Saba is the fact that on my last visit, the telephone is my room did not work at all. And the mini-refrigerators in the rooms are old and work very poorly. Both of these negatives are regrettable and really inappropriate for a hotel that caters to an international clientele. I must say, however, that when I expressed concern that the caviar I had bought in town needed better refrigeration than my mini-refrigerator provided, the Sabaâ€™s staff was happy to let me keep it in their big refrigerator until I left. I intend to visit Istanbul, one of my favorite cities, many more times; and I will always be happy to stay at the Hotel Saba. Laurence R. Richter Bloomington, Indiana USA

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hebs01
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in. Its in the best location next to a lot of attractions and 2 mins walk to the tram stop (which you will use to get around the city)!! The room was exceptionally clean and the shower was so powerful. The staff are so so friendly and do everything they can to help and advise you. The room has a TV with about 35 channels - most are turkish (although watching turkish deal or no deal was kinda fun) and there are a few in English - MTV, CNN and a movie channel. The breakfast is good - simple but very tasty - and the view is fab!!!! If your looking for a nice little hotel in a good location and friendly staff then this is for you. Istanbul is a great city and our experience in this hotel helped make the trip a truly amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lexigat
Reviews.Content: This hostel has a perfect location, two minutes from the blue mosque and very closed to every important touristic attraction. The hostel is very clean, and staff is very helpful. After Sales services as well is a plus point: I forgot my mobile in the hostel and they made all the necessary to send it back to me! Furthermore, the view during the breakfast is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jclaire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We were allocated a double room with a balcony overlooking the back of the hotel. The room was tiny with little storage space, but otherwise fine. It was kept very clean. We had breakfast - an assortment of cheeses, salad, yhogurts, jam, cerial, bread up in the rooftop terrace. There was a wonderful view overlooking the mosque. We had supper for 3 nights at the restauraunt next door. The people there were exceptonally pleasant and always gave us extra food without charging us. On the last night we tried somewhere else but didn't like it as much. We were able to visit most places on foot. We particularly enjoyed the spice market. This is not open on Sundays. We found the Turkish people to be very friendly and helpful. We were ripped of by a taxi driver but this didnt spoil our holiday. He pulled off the scam of pretending that we hadn't given him the right note in payment for the fare. When we mentioned it at the hotel they said that this happends fairly frequently. Overall a pleasant stay and the experience has made us decide that we will take a holiday in Turkey next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellers79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely wonderful! Staff is most helpful, the location is just 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque and 5 minutes from Hagia Sophia, but still the voice of muazzin (the one calling for prayer) is very pleasant and not too loud like in some hotels at Sultanahmet (Old CIty). The view from the terrace is absolutely breathtaking, looking at the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus. The brekfast is served on this terrace so it's a real pleasure! The price goes down the longer you stay and is very acceptable for such comfortable conditions! Have a nice stay in Istanbul! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you get a good room”
Reviews.Author: LBDessex
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were originally given a room with two beds, but managed to negotiate a better room. Unfortunately it smelled of smoke, but we could open the windows and air it out. Istanbul was freezing in january so we could not really enjoy the roof-top terrace, but the heating in the room was adequate. The breakfast was great with delicious cheeses! Well worth a visit to this great city and if I had the chance to go again I would stay at Saba - but just make sure I got a double room!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Saba
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek mah. Sehit Mehmet Pasa Yokusu Sokak No 8 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
